full_threads.body:
Hi Mark,

Sorry about that. We have made the updates on the first link. Please let us know if you would like further changes.

Ahh, I get it, I will write a couple more entries to put with it.

The text on the first link is the old text I originally sent, can this be updated to the text I sent today please?

Otherwise looks great and is ready to go!

Many thanks
Mark

Hi Mark,

Confirming that we have already made the updates and it's ready for you to review it. Regarding the first link https://drmarkboccola.com.au/journal/, this is the page where all of your journal summary will show and the other link is the page of the actual journal you have written. Hope that make sense.

Please let us know if you would like further changes.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Rica Rosario Valencia

full_threads.body:
Hi,

With the first link it is all bunched over to the left of the screen so I prefer the second link much better!

The text was to long so I have cut it down to a shorter article, this is my last change! Please see attachment (picture is the same).

Can the top menu read from left to right Home, About, Surgery, Journal, FAQs, Contact.

Many thanks
Mark

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

Here is the first 'Journal' entry, I have put a shutterstock image link at the top.

I saw this idea at my gyms website www.fit.com.au- but if you guys have a better way to make it look good that's awesome.

Let me know if there are any problems.

Cheers
Mark.

attachments.filename: Protein intake after weight loss surgery.docx

full_threads.body:
Hi Mark,

Yes, this is a good idea from a SEO perspective. We can certainly create this for you.

We will send you a hidden link to preview the setup towards the end of this week. In the meantime, if you can send through the first article for us to upload that would be great.
@heath i think you should be the one to follow up with Dr. Boccola.

Hi Heath,

I've noticed on some fitness industry pages their website has a 'Journal' section where there are 300-500 word short articles posted regularly- is that something that would help improve SEO? (is putting new content on the site regularly important?)

If its worthwhile then I think I will add that section and commit to posting at least one article per month. In order to keep the overall look of the menu bar I would put the 'Post-operative care' page under the 'Patient FAQs' heading. This will allow room on the menu for the 'Journal' section without changing the appearance of the website to much.

Thanks,
Mark.

Sent from Yahoo7 Mail on Android
